title: Ticket #5619: drain command does not return assigned drain id.
description:
The condor_drain command does not receive or report the drain id that is assigned when a drain command is successfully handled.

It is clear from the code that the API was intending to return the drain id, but since the condor_drain command did not report it, the fact the the id was not returned went unnoticed.

Since the drain API both sends and receives ClassAds, it will be possible to fix this without breaking backward compatibililty.
remarks:
2016-Apr-19 11:25:46 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW All is fine.
